intro: Jacquemontia paniculata, commonly known as the yellow wood vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other climbing plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow, funnel-shaped flowers. It is a perennial vine that thrives in moist, wooded areas. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological study.
